author: Special Correspondent
text:
The students team of Panchayat Union Middle School, Vedapatti village in Ayothiyapattanam union has excelled in the national level Activity Based Learning competitions.

The project submitted by a five-member team of the school titled “clean water; clear smile’ has been selected as one of the 100 best projects.The students of the middle schools from Standards I to V were being imparted training in Activity Based Learning by the Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan. The students were motivated to develop projects of solving the problems confronting them on their own.

Design for Change conducted the national level competition for the projects.

Student teams from 2,512 schools from across the country, including 1,400 government and private middle schools from Tamil Nadu, participated in the competition and presented projects.

A cash award of Rs. 10,000 each was presented the best 100 projects. The projects submitted by 23 schools from Tamil Nadu were in the list of the 100 best projects. The prizes were distributed at a function held at Ahmadabad recently.

D. Sabitha, Secretary, School Education Department, Pooja Kulkarni, State Project Director, Sarva Shiksha Abhiyan, felicitated the students along with R. Ilavarasan, graduate teacher of the middle school, at Chennai.

Later at a brief event, A. Gnanagowri, Chief Educational Officer, and A. Thangaraj, District Elementary Education Officer, felicitated K. Vairamani, headmistress of the school, Ilavrasan and the students for their achievement.
title: Panchayat school project selected
